text:
STANLEY ANDREWS
Executive Director
National Project in Agricultural Communications
AMERICAN ASSOCIATION OF LAND-GRANT COLLEGES AND STATE UNIVERSITIES • AMERICAN ASSOCIATION OF AGRICULTURAL COLLEGE EDITORS
WELLS HALL • MICHIGAN STATE UNIVERSITY
EAST LANSING, MICHIGAN
January 2k 9 195>8
Mr. Raymond D. Cheydleur
Chairman, NAEB Research Committee
The Florida State University
Tallahassee, Florida
Dear Ray:
It's satisfying to know that the people who underwrote
the research seminar see in it many of the values that I’m
sure were realized by the participants.
The inventory-digest of radio research that was discussed
briefly at the end of the seminar has made good progress. Ken
Harwood's people are going to submit a proposal to undertake
the work. Equally promising is the possibility of making the
project a three-way undertaking between NAEB, ETRC, and NPAC.
NAEB has agreed to go in on a one-third share basis and I am
hopeful that ETRC will also agree to come in.
Aside from the economics of the venture, the possibility
of a cooperative approach has exciting possibilities related to
the quality, distribution, and impact of the end product.
I'll keep in touch on developments.
Sincerely yours.
Jomf M. Parsey
Research Director
